definition: to defend oneself/to rebut a charge
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen

sentences.english: You can't explain such conduct for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你不能为这种行为申辩。

sentences.english: Mr. Simms, I'll give you one final opportunity to speak up.
sentences.chinese: 西门斯先生我给你最后一次机会申辩。

sentences.english: He had the honour of being presented to the Governor .
sentences.chinese: 他们向州长提出了宽刑的申辩书。

sentences.english: An excuse unexpected arouses suspicion from its slumbers.
sentences.chinese: 一次意料之外的申辩，会唤醒原本沉睡的怀疑。

sentences.english: Everybody agree them, without Joan, she is having a averment .
sentences.chinese: 所有人都同意，除了贞德，她申辩着。

sentences.english: Woods was taken to court. He pleaded not guilty and for an attorney.
sentences.chinese: 伍德被带到法庭，他申辩无罪，并要求律师为他辩护。

sentences.english: They can only make recommendations and argue for them.
sentences.chinese: 他们只能做出建议并为其申辩。

sentences.english: They addressed to the governor a plea for clemency.
sentences.chinese: 他们向州长提出了宽刑的申辩书。

sentences.english: Before putting forward the handling suggestions, should listen to the student's explanation.
sentences.chinese: 在提出处理意见之前，应当听取留学生的陈述和申辩。

sentences.english: The AP had argued that royalty’s public actions are of public concern.
sentences.chinese: 美联社此前的申辩是，皇室的公共活动为公众所关注。

sentences.english: The judge assented to allow the prisoner to speak.
sentences.chinese: 法官同意允许犯人申辩。

sentences.english: The woman charged with murder was said to be mad and unfit to plead.
sentences.chinese: 被控犯谋杀罪的女人据说疯了，因此不适合出庭申辩。

definition: to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to speak in defense of/to argue in favor of/to defend/to plead
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
to file a complaint/to appeal (to an authority, a higher court of justice etc)/complaint/appeal
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
